","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"(","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"what is beauty?","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":") by ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Vandana George","marks":[{"type":"italic"},{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", is a sensitive poem on societal standards of beauty seen through the eyes of a child to a young woman. Gradually as she grows, the young girl starts questioning the standards of beauty of the world she is growing up in, and as a young woman concludes, ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"\"","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"they all are wrong, 'coz. when they are not wrong, I am not beautiful!\"","marks":[{"type":"bold"},{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"A beautiful rendition of सुंदरता क्या है?/sundartaa kyaa hai?  by Vandana George (in her own voice!) :","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"4Fbu7JGWF2cfPZgUPHRZfi","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}

references.title: सुंदरता क्या है?/sundartaa kyaa hai? (what is beauty?) by Vandana George in her own voice

body.raw: {"nodeType":"document","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"2.","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" In his ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"quest to figure out his identity, Edwin","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Grove","marks":[{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"'s ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"British Edwin ","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"Indian Edwin","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" have an internal dialogue, debating whether he is British or Indian. In the process, while he recognizes a bit of both in him, Edwin comes to the conclusion that ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"due to casteism in India he does not want to be called Indian","marks":[{"type":"italic"},{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":", and ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"due to racism in England he does not want to be called British","marks":[{"type":"italic"},{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". He ends stating, he is both, Indian and British,","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":" but would like to be a world citizen","marks":[{"type":"italic"},{"type":"bold"}],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":". ","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"In this cleverly debated - sometimes lighthearted - identity quest, ","marks":[],"data":{}},{"nodeType":"text","value":"we learn the bitter truth of caste based discrimination faced by Edwin's maternal grandfather. ","marks":[{"type":"italic"}],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"Read Edwin's internal debate in his own hand:","marks":[],"data":{}}]},{"nodeType":"embedded-asset-block","data":{"target":{"sys":{"id":"79TmePVybjD8NDaPcyhSyV","type":"Link","linkType":"Asset"}}},"content":[]},{"nodeType":"paragraph","data":{},"content":[{"nodeType":"text","value":"","marks":[],"data":{}}]}]}
